text.p: Here are the highlights of stories in the Danish press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

--- Danish transport minister Jan Troejborg is to launch a new plan to set up a limited company under Danish State Rail responsible for the entire metropolitan and suburban train system in the Copenhagen area. The company will finance new trains with loans from the private loan market.

--- A new Danish Chamber of Commerce survey shows that the number of companies which take environmental issues into consideration when choosing suppliers has doubled within the last two years to 41 percent this year from only 21 percent in 1994.

--- According to a foreign ministry report, Danish companies are making solid earnings from supplying United Nations agencies. Total Danish deliveries to U.N. organisations amounted to 1.5 billion crowns in 1995, 34 percent up on the previous year.

--- A survey of Denmark's 1,000 largest companies concludes that lower taxes are the key to better business conditions and more jobs. Denmark's high tax level is severely hitting major companies such as Lego toy group Lego which claims that high wage levels are adversely affecting export competitiveness.

--- Denmark's police intelligence has now adopted a new approach in the fight to quell the ever escalating biker war between the Hell's Angels and Bandidos motorcycle gangs in Scandinavia, openly using agents and phone tapping.
